attributes.action: demand the BBC stop removing clips of their programmes from YouTube.com for breaching copyright. The production of these programmes is paid for by the license payers and therefore the copyright should also remain with the license payers who should be free to publish clips of the shows onto the internet.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The BBC need to realise we pay for these programmes therefore we own the copyright and should be allowed to broadcast them publically on the internet for our viewing pleasure. Until such times as the BBC provide a freely accessible library of their old programmes to British citizens, we demand they should stop removing clips from YouTube. Once they have set up such a facility they may then remove all BBC owned clips from the site.
